abstract: Informs a custom video compositor about upcoming rendering requests.
overview:
## Discussion

In this method, the compositor can load composition resources, such as overlay images, that will be needed in the anticipated rendering time range.

Unlike the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositing/startRequest(_:)] method, which is invoked only when the frame compositing is necessary, this method is typically called every frame duration. It allows the custom compositor to load and unload a composition resource such as overlay images at an appropriate time.

In forward playback, the render hint’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/startCompositionTime] is less than its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/endCompositionTime]. In reverse playback, its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/endCompositionTime] is less than its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/startCompositionTime]. For seeking, the two values are equivalent, which means the upcoming composition request time range is unknown.

This method is guaranteed to be called before [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositing/startRequest(_:)] for a given composition time.

This method is synchronous. Make sure that your implementation returns quickly to ensure that playback doesn’t stall and cause frame drops.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositing/anticipateRendering(using:)

# anticipateRendering(using:)

**Instance Method**

Informs a custom video compositor about upcoming rendering requests.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func anticipateRendering(using renderHint: AVVideoCompositionRenderHint)
```

## Parameters

- **renderHint**: Information about the upcoming composition requests.

## Discussion

In this method, the compositor can load composition resources, such as overlay images, that will be needed in the anticipated rendering time range.

Unlike the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositing/startRequest(_:)] method, which is invoked only when the frame compositing is necessary, this method is typically called every frame duration. It allows the custom compositor to load and unload a composition resource such as overlay images at an appropriate time.

In forward playback, the render hint’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/startCompositionTime] is less than its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/endCompositionTime]. In reverse playback, its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/endCompositionTime] is less than its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositionRenderHint/startCompositionTime]. For seeking, the two values are equivalent, which means the upcoming composition request time range is unknown.

This method is guaranteed to be called before [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVVideoCompositing/startRequest(_:)] for a given composition time.

This method is synchronous. Make sure that your implementation returns quickly to ensure that playback doesn’t stall and cause frame drops.

## Preparing to render frames

- **prerollForRendering(using:)**: Tells a custom video compositor to perform any work in the prerolling phase.
- **AVVideoCompositionRenderHint**: Information about upcoming composition requests, such as composition start time and end time.
